column4: hi all is there a comparable package in Gnome for KPPP?  I bought this stupid internet card from the store and it says to use KPPP but in Gnome this package doesn't exist and if I don't have it I can't get on line to get it?  any help?
did you try searching "ppp" in synaptic?
Yep, found several packages.. including some wvdialer.. but that refuses to work for me complains it can't find my modem...
if the modem really is installed, it should appear in network manager
Sorry I'm not following how that will help me to "Dial up"
also, you could download and save the kppp package to a mass storage device, and install it from there
in gnome network manager you can also set dialing options, HOWEVER I'd really recommend doing the command line thing somebody suggested to you
ok, one more question where is the package cache?
the important thing is that you just get them all, there is a graphical installer in gnome (Gdebi) that you can use from nautilus
Gdebi won't let you mess it up
ok I understand that but after I get them downloaded and put on my flash how do I get them into the new Ubuntu install?
Remembering that till I get KPP up and going.. I have no internet.
you log in your ubuntu install, and with nautilus navigate to the folder where you saved them
so It will find all the dep's  as long as they are all in the same folder?
it won't let you install a library if you miss the dependencies, so in the worst case you will be forced to install each package in the proper order
by trial and error, you know... :)
ok well wish me Luck I'm off :)
